name: Mudskipper
description: They have an elongated body, a large head with bulging eyes, and paired fins with muscular bases.
attractions: They live at the interface of tides, where water levels, salinity, and temperature fluctuate significantly. They spend much of their life above water, using muscular fin bases to crawl over mud surfaces and low aerial roots. Their prominently bulging eyes allow them to scan their surroundings both in water and on land. They can breathe air, not with lungs, but by mixing it with water retained in their gill chambers.
